page.title: 01FARMING
page.content: The area is one of mixed farming.Crops grown inclued grass, for hay and silage, barley and rape seed. There is some stock rearing and dairy farming. A stud farm breeding thoroughbred horses is in the area, also a large horticultural nursery extending to some 10 acres growing chrysanthemums under glass for the London market. Farms are generally quite small, 100 acres or below, but there is one large dairy farm of some 900 acres. Farmland in this area has become somewhat fragmented over the past few years with larger units being split up and sold off in smaller lots of 4 to 25 acres, to be used as grazing for horses. Fields tend to be small, 8 to 15 acres with established hedgerows. Apples were extensively grown here some years ago but there is now only one commercial orchard left.
